intro: Octopleura rubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Polypodiaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial ferns. The plant is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks in its natural habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant in greenhouses and botanical gardens.
